Description: A hollow terracotta standing figure of a female saint or beneficent demon, very close indeed to registration no. 1926,0520.16, above, and of an earlier generation in the same series. The details are rather clearer, and the back has an incuse palm branch from top to bottom rather than a series of lines. The circles in the V of the necklace are in relief and not incuse. A large part of the lower body is lost. Two-piece mould. Pink Aswan kaolinite clay, covered with an overall yellow-white slip. Details of decoration - the face, hair and wreath, breasts, clothing and jewellery - are picked out in black fired-on ceramic colour, with touches of orange.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. Excavated at Oxyrhynchus. Late Roman, sixth to seventh century AD. Comparanda: See registration no. 1926,0520.16.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3393)
